chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.
items.plainText: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.

items.text: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
items.plainText: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.

items.text: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD trieth the hearts.
items.plainText: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD trieth the hearts.

items.text: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
items.plainText: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.

items.text: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.
items.plainText: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.

items.text: Children's children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.
items.plainText: Children's children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.

items.text: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.
items.plainText: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.

items.text: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
items.plainText: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.

items.text: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.
items.plainText: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.

items.text: A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.
items.plainText: A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.

items.text: An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
items.plainText: An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

items.text: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.
items.plainText: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

items.text: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
items.plainText: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

items.text: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.
items.plainText: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.

items.text: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.
items.plainText: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.

items.text: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?
items.plainText: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?

items.text: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
items.plainText: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

items.text: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
items.plainText: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.

items.text: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
items.plainText: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.

items.text: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
items.plainText: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.

items.text: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.
items.plainText: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.

items.text: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.
items.plainText: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

items.text: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.
items.plainText: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.

items.text: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
items.plainText: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

items.text: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.
items.plainText: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.

items.text: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.
items.plainText: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.

items.text: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
items.plainText: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.

items.text: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
items.plainText: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
